main_text:
Objections to Dialetheism
4. Objections to Dialetheism

We now turn to arguments against dialetheism. The most prominent
sustained defence of the LNC in the history of philosophy is, as
mentioned,
 that given by Aristotle
 in Chapter 4 of Metaphysics, \(\Gamma\). A critical analysis
of Aristotle’s arguments is given point-for-point by Priest
(1998b/2006 ch.1), who finds them to often conflate dialetheism with
trivialism (that is, conflating the claim that some contradictions are
true, and the one that all contradictions are). We will look at some
more modern arguments against dialetheism.
